com.topcoder.util.sql.databaseabstraction.ondemandconversion
Class ShortConverter

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.sql.databaseabstraction.ondemandconversion.ShortConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnDemandConverter
public class ShortConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnDemandConverter

The ShortConverter class handles on demand conversions from the Short type to various other data types. It implements the OnDemandConverter interface and has no state.

When a value is converted by ShortConverter, the condition that value can be converted is: value is a Short and not null, and desiredType is Byte, BigDecimal, Integer, Long, Float, Double, or String.

Thread Safety: - This class is immutable, and therefore thread-safe.

Since:
1.1
Version:
1.1
Author:
aubergineanode, justforplay

Method Detail

canConvert

public boolean canConvert(java.lang.Object value,
                          int column,
                          CustomResultSetMetaData metaData,
                          java.lang.Class desiredType)

Tells whether value can be converted to desiredType. The condition that value can be converted is: value is a Short and not null, and desiredType is Byte, BigDecimal, Integer, Long, Float, Double, or String.

Specified by:
canConvert in interface OnDemandConverter
Parameters:
value - The value to determine if conversion is possible (may be null)
column - The column the value came from
metaData - The metaData for the result set (can be used to obtain info about the column)
desiredType - The desired return type for the conversion
Returns:
True if this converter can do the conversion, false otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If metaData or desiredType is null or column <= 0 or > column count of metadata.

convert

public java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object value,
                                int column,
                                CustomResultSetMetaData metaData,
                                java.lang.Class desiredType)
                         throws IllegalMappingException

Converts value into an instance of desiredType. If value is a Short and not null, and desiredType is Byte, BigDecimal, Integer, Long, Float, Double, or String, value is converted to the corresponding type and returned.

Specified by:
convert in interface OnDemandConverter
Parameters:
value - The object we want to convert (may be null)
column - The index of the column that the value is in the CustomResultSet. This can be used to retrieve metadata about the column
metaData - The metadata for the result set the object comes from
desiredType - The type that we want to convert the object to
Returns:
value converted into an instance of desiredType (must be non-null)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If metaData or desiredType is null or column is <= 0 or > column count of metadata
IllegalMappingException - If the conversion can not be made
